Our people are our greatest asset and we value every one of them. We are an equal opportunity employer who adhere to our core values & reflect this in our day to day life. So, please come & see why we’re so successful in one of the most competitive and fastest growing industries in the world.

If you are our B2B eCommerce Data Scientist, you will be part of a global agile organization, working on complex business challenges. You will play key part in making sure that eCommerce strategy is driven by the facts, numbers & data. You will drive key observations derivation from the Customers behaviors, Operational performance metrices, User Support SLAs and translate to them to the meaningful insights for the Executive stakeholders’ community. As a Data Scientist you will have an opportunity to proactively shape eCommerce growth strategy including Marketing Campaigns, Cross & Up-sell roadmap, sales forecasting, and Customers’ health improvement.
 
  Responsibilities:
 
   Customer Purchasing behaviour analysis with strong Unassisted Ordering pattern growth
   Customer health (ex. Customer stickiness, ordering patterns) verification and improvement actions recommendation
   Site visits (view heatmap, page exits, …) analysis and UX improvement strategy definition
   Marketing Campaigns results analysis, A/B Testing performance
   “At-Risk” Customer identification and Customer Reactivation ownership
   New success metrics / KPIs identification
   Robotics & Automation opportunities identification
   Voice Of the Customer (VOC) Improvement areas definition and communication to the respective stakeholders
   eCommerce enhancements success factors definition and measurement and sign-off with stakeholders
 
 
  Are you a high-performer? We are looking for an individual with:
 
   Typically 4-6 years of related experience in data science area
   Strong analytical & statistical skills including data modeling (ex. sales forecasting) and actionable insights creation
   Strong consensus-building and influencing skills
   Knowledge of programing languages like SQL. Machine Learning algorithms experience preferred
   Knowledge of Python is a must
   Strong knowledge and skills with other business applications (e.g. Excel, SharePoint, PowerPoint, Outlook, Teams, Jira)
   Previous experience in eCommerce and/or Digital experience preferred
   Ability to interact with all levels of the company, including senior management
   Proven ability to work with cross-functional teams and achieve results, meeting deliverables on time and at the required quality
   Drive for results through creativity and innovation.
   Previous experience in eCommerce and/or Digital experience preferred
 
 
  Scope & Impact:
 
   Serves as tech lead to product and program managers to understand the business problem.
   Works with software engineers to understand systems and craft interfaces to model for deployment.
   Interacts with team collecting data to define collection protocols and assure data quality.
   Codes, trains, validates and optimizes machine learning models, possibly crafting new model architectures, optimization techniques or objective functions.
 
  Education and Experience:
 
   Masters Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, and/or Math or equivalent, demonstrated through work experience, journal and/or conference publications or open-source projects, PhD preferred.
   6+ years experience.
 
 
   About HP
 
  
  
  
 
  You’re out to reimagine and reinvent what’s possible—in your career as well as the world around you.
  
 
   So are we. We love taking on tough challenges, disrupting the status quo, and creating what’s next. We’re in search of talented people who are inspired by big challenges, driven to learn and grow, and dedicated to making a meaningful difference.
 
  
  
 
   HP is a technology company that operates in more than 170 countries around the world united in creating technology that makes life better for everyone, everywhere.
 
  
  
 
   Our history: HP’s commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion – it's just who we are.
  
 
   From the boardroom to factory floor, we create a culture where everyone is respected and where people can be themselves, while being a part of something bigger than themselves. We celebrate the notion that you can belong at HP and bring your authentic self to work each and every day. When you do that, you’re more innovative and that helps grow our bottom line. Come to HP and thrive!
positionName: Business to Business E-Commerce Data Scientist

description:
Caring for the world, one person at a time has inspired and united the people of Johnson & Johnson for over 125 years. We embrace research and science - bringing creative ideas, products and services to advance the health and well-being of people. Every day, our more than 130,000 employees across the world are blending heart, science and ingenuity to profoundly change the trajectory of health for humanity. 
     At Johnson & Johnson Medical Devices Companies, we are using our breadth, scale and experience to reimagine the way healthcare is delivered and help people live longer, healthier lives. 
     In a radically changing environment, we are making connections across science and technology to combine our own expertise in surgery, orthopaedics, vision and interventional solutions with the big ideas of others to design and deliver physician and patient-centric products and solutions. 
     As pioneers in our industry, we continually focus on elevating the standard of care—working to expand patient access, improve outcomes, reduce health system costs and drive value. We create people-centered healthcare to help the patients we serve recover faster and live longer and more vibrantly. 
     Essential duties and responsibilities: 
     Data Ownership 
     
      
       Build data science solutions that address measurable business problems within Med Tech Asia Pacific Supply Chain 
      
      
       Partner with IT teams to transition proof of concept analytics work into a production-maintained environment 
      
      
       Deploy detailed solutions, including automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, machine learning, and other sophisticated analytics solutions 
      
      
       Develop a solid understanding of the Med Tech data source and reporting systems and databases, and associated data relationships. 
      
      
       Work with multi-functional technology, analytics and business teams to convert use cases and POCs into technology enabled minimally viable products (MVPs) and ultimately into scalable full stack solutions, using Agile methodologies 
      
      
       Collaborate with internal collaborators to ensure development of new data, reporting and analytics capabilities to support the Analytics Maturity Roadmap. 
      
     
     Insight Generation 
     
      
       Build groundbreaking predictive models using descriptive statistics and data mining techniques to give practical recommendations to Deliver internal partners on how to best drive business performance using data. 
      
      
       Build analytics tools that use the data pipeline to provide concrete insights into customer acquisition, operational efficiency, and other key business performance metrics. 
      
      
       Identify valuable data sources and automate collection processes; undertake preprocessing of structured and unstructured data. 
      
      
       Work closely with business to identify issues and use data to propose solutions for effective decision making. 
      
      
       Support end-to-end Process Mining initiatives across various processes and segments 
      
      
       Reveal process inefficiencies & bottlenecks, and turn those insights into actions 
      
     
     Qualifications 
     Essential knowledge and skills: 
     
      A Bachelor’s Degree is required (Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Operations Research, mathematics, Engineering, IT or related field is preferred); advanced degree is a plus. 
      A minimum of 5 years of business experience is required; experience in logistics, customer service or supply chain function and roles of data engineer, data scientist or data analyst is highly preferred. 
      Hands-on experience Process Mining and/or BI tools is helpful 
      Knowledge or experience in working with ETL tools and Enterprise Supply Chain IT solutions (SAP, WMS, TMS, etc.) is required. 
      Detailed understanding of business process mapping, master data management, integration frameworks, and system connectivity is desired. 
      Knowledge or experience in working with Azure, Cloudera and Teradata is preferred. 
      Experience in developing analytics capabilities and approaches is preferred. 
      Designing and developing process monitoring dashboards and process execution instruments 
     
     Core proficiencies required for this role: 
     
      Excellent data management experience using Excel, SQL, Alteryx and experience sourcing, analyzing and structuring data in a variety of database environments. 
      Proven knowledge and/or experience in scripting and programming, query languages, business/data understanding, data importing and statistical modeling. 
      Experience using data visualization and reporting technologies such as Tableau and Power BI, and designing, implementing and automating a range of reports and dashboards. 
      Confidence and gravitas to approach a broad range of partners across the business and gather requirements and develop informative and commercially helpful visualizations. 
      Experience working in a sophisticated or ambitious data environment or sourcing data from multiple disparate sources, with consistent track record to turn things around and add measurable commercial value through collaboration. 
      Analytical and data-oriented personality with good communication skills and ability to partner with collaborators across all levels of the organization and cross-functionally. 
      Self-starter / entrepreneurial. 
     
     Are you ready to impact the world? 
     Johnson & Johnson offers an unusual experience to professionals looking for an opportunity to work with hardworking people who share your real passion for caring in an environment that empowers you to drive your own career. 
     We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. 
     This description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.

Eightfold was founded with a vision to solve for employment in our society. For decades, the connection between individuals and opportunities has been based on who the individuals are and the strength of their network, vs. their potential. Eightfold leverages artificial intelligence to transform how to think about skills and capabilities for individuals as well as how jobs and career decisions are made. Eightfold offers the industry’s first AI-powered Talent Intelligence Platform to transform how organizations plan, hire, develop and retain a diverse workforce, enabling individuals to transform their careers. 
 
 
 
  To date, Eightfold AI has received more than $410 million in funding and a valuation of over $2B from leading investors to further our mission of finding the right career for everyone in the world. If you are passionate about solving one of the most fundamental challenges of our society - employment, working on hard business problems, and being part of an amazing growth story - Eightfold is the place to be! 
 
 
 
  You may want to refer to the media coverage on TechCrunch and Reuters. 
 
 
  Eightfold.ai is led by 
  Ashutosh Garg, a PhD in Machine Learning/IIT Delhi alumni who managed Search and Personalization at Google, and 
  Varun Kacholia- IIT Bombay alumni, who led the News Feed Ranking team at Facebook and developed YouTube Search at Google. 
 
 
 
  Our customers 
 
 
  Press ﻿ 
 
 
 
  About the Role: 
 
 
  
 
  The Data Platform team at Eightfold is responsible for building and scaling the complete data life cycle management: starting from bringing data from different external systems, normalizing them to a common data model, keeping them updated, archive them as needed, auditing to check the health of the platform, provide API access to the data, etc. We’re looking for engineers with a systems and data mindset who are curious and are looking to learn and ship code. Some of the interesting projects the team has worked on in the past include a generic framework to sync millions of records from various systems to keep the data updated, a framework to identify and automatically fix data inconsistencies between different storage systems.
   
 
 
  
 
  Primary Responsibilities: 
 
 
  
 
  
   Build data integrations and frameworks to ensure data quality/integration efficiency 
  
  
   Solve complex and technically challenging problems on a large scale. 
  
  
   Build REST API endpoints and also consume external REST endpoints 
  
  
   Build our application stack on AWS. Our platform is used by millions of users and processes terabytes of data and our team supports a multitude of services that leverage this data. 
  
  
   Learn about data storage systems like Mysql, Solr, Redshift, DynamoDB, S3, Redis. 
  
 
 
  
 
  Qualifications: 
 
 
  
 
  
   2 to 3 years of experience in product development (We have roles across levels) 
  
  
   Solid foundation in programming (any language!) 
  
  
   Bonus: Strong fundamentals in distributed systems 
  
  
   Bonus: Previous experience working on data platforms

Function Overview:
  Citi’s Treasury and Trade Solutions group is built on the power of our network. Citi Treasury and Trade Solutions (TTS), provides integrated cash management and trade finance services to multinational corporations, financial institutions and public sector organizations across the globe. With a full range of digital and mobile enabled platforms, tools and analytics, TTS continues to lead the way in delivering innovative and tailored solutions to its clients. TTS offers the industry’s most comprehensive suite of treasury and trade solutions including cash management, payments, receivables, liquidity management and investment services, working capital solutions, commercial card programs, trade finance and services.
  TTS counts 80% of Global Fortune 500, over 1,100 public sector entities and thousands of financial institutions amongst its diverse client base Doing business in 160 countries and jurisdictions, and transacting in over 140 currencies, TTS processes around USD 4.0 trillion of client payments everyday Collaborates with clients to deliver next-generation financial solutions using TTS Innovation Labs
 
  Team Overview:
  Citibank® Commercial Cards offers card-based payment solutions to large corporations and federal and state governments for the procurement of goods and services as well as travel, entertainment, and fleet related expenses. Commercial Cards' strategic objective is to compete and differentiate on the basis of global capability and customized solutions for high-value customers.
 
  Role Description:
  We are seeking for Senior QA Analyst for Commercial Card’s testing team with rich amount of experience in Commercial / Consumer Credit Cards domain. The successful candidate will interact with development, testing, and production support teams, as well as other departments within Citigroup (such as the System Administrators, Database Administrators, Data Centre Operations, and Change Control groups) for TTS commercial cards VisionPlus platform.
 
  Should be able to envision and strategize Testing Automation Roadmap and execute upon the same . Should have proven track record of performing Testing Automation with notable achievements in terms of Zero Touch Automation, Test Data Harvesting, Induction of Industry Leading Tools and Automation Frameworks. Should be an Innovator and Change Catalyst who can imbibe Automation in the DNA of the organization . Technical Expertise in Java and Selenium is preferred. Implement Automation framework to accelerate regression and Functional / In-Sprint Automation.
  Need to present communication and diplomacy skills in order to guide, influence and convince others, in particular colleagues across functional/scrum teams. Responsibility includes support for high volume validation, best in class quality and timely delivery of end results.
  Qualifications:
 
   Bachelor’s/University degree or equivalent experience
   6 to 8 years of experience working as QA Engineer / Analyst with Strong Commercial / Consumer Credit Cards domain knowledge. Vision Plus product experience is preferred
   Hands on experience Credit Cards Functional and Automation Testing is expected
   Interpersonal, and communication skills, with high attention to minute details.
 
 
  Technical / Functional Proficiency:
 
   Design & Build test harnesses for Functional Testing as SME. 
  Implement the QA process and automated testing for all the modules to improve the testing cycle.
   Design/Architect test automation framework and develop the new test automation libraries; Tool : Selenium/Postman/Rest Assured/Lean FT-FINSIM/Testing Framework: Cucumber-Test Ng-FAST.
   Support automation of Test Data Management for Credit cards
   Exposure to NFT is preferred
   Exposure in Service Test automation and Service Virtualization
   Good exposure to Microservices architecture
   Exposure to AI and Machine Learning is preferred
   Utilize appropriate testing tools for both front-end and back-end Quality Assurance.
   Identify testable events and develop the test cases / test scripts.
   Describing Existing Automation Architecture, Participate in Design and Architecture Meeting.
   Build and configure new interfaces to support testing activities.
   Participate in testing, deployment prep and actual deployment.
 
 
  Leadership Skills:
 
   A good understanding of the credit card industry and functions of Cards and different types of settlement across APAC, EMEA and LATAM.
   The Test Lead must be able to take on leadership responsibilities and influence the direction of the automation effort, and its schedule and prioritization.
   Must be able to identify how test team aligns within the organization and how his/her team would achieve the roadmap identified for the project and the organization.
   Must identify the required metrics and work to have them in place. These metrics could be an inherent goal for the test team.
   Flexible to work across different Time zones supporting stakeholders across LATAM, EMEA and ASPAC regions.
   Must identify the testing effort required by calculating the sizing needed for the given release and plan the required effort for the same.
   Possess excellent verbal and written communication skills, both technical and functional.
   Demonstrate excellent leadership, interpersonal, and team building skills.
   Managing time and changing priorities in a dynamic environment.
 
 
  -
  Job Family Group: Technology
  -
  Job Family: Applications Development
  -
  Time Type: Full time
  -
  Citi is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer.
 
  Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.
 
  Citigroup Inc. and its subsidiaries ("Citi”) invite all qualified interested applicants to apply for career opportunities. If you are a person with a disability and need a reasonable accommodation to use our search tools and/or apply for a career opportunity review Accessibility at Citi.

description:
JOB TITLE : SENIOR CONSULTANT 

CAREER LEVEL: D1 

 Embrace novel and varied challenges working across the business 
Be connected to different functions, areas and roles across the business. We are supported by leaders in our aspiration to break down boundaries and draw on inter-functional learnings. It means we get to face interesting business problems and varied data. One day working along the whole development cycle from molecules to delivery, the next supporting HR processes or medicine launches 

 ABOUT ASTRAZENECA 

 AstraZeneca is a global, science-led, patient-focused biopharmaceutical company that focuses on the discovery, development and commercialisation of prescription medicines for some of the world’s most serious disease. But we’re more than one of the world’s leading pharmaceutical companies. At AstraZeneca we’re dedicated to being a Great Place to Work. 

 ABOUT THE TEAM 
A team of deep specialists, our skills range from mathematics to computation. Our diversity is our strength. We turning complex information into lifechanging and practical insights, every day. Our progressive operating model means that we stay at the forefront. Evolving and learning from what we’re seeing externally. 
We impact patients lives. Empowering and enabling the business to run faster and better, we play a part in improving lives across the world. 

 ABOUT THE ROLE 
Do you have expertise in developing data pipeline managing massive amounts of data? Would you like to apply the latest industry-accepted technologies and methods in machine learning and AI in a company that follows science and turns ideas into life-changing medicines? Then AstraZeneca might be the one for you! 
AstraZeneca is a global, science-led, patient-focused biopharmaceutical company that focuses on the discovery, development, and commercialization of prescription medicines for some of the world’s most serious diseases. But we’re more than one of the world’s leading pharmaceutical companies. 
The data science and AI team is focused on delivering innovations, science & technology and seeking out opportunity. We are looking for passionate, motivated individuals to help architect and develop solutions working closely with Data scientists, business, and brand partners. A successful candidate will have deep technical hands-on expertise in the public cloud including AWS, Google Cloud, Azure 
We are currently looking for an experienced Senior Data Engineer who can successfully productize AI models and insights to end user applications applying industry-wide standard methodologies following the security, compliance, and regulatory guidelines 

 MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES 
Joining the Data Science and AI team, you will provide architecture and processes for managing data pipelines. Input data coming in from diverse sources should be linked and cleansed to generate patient cohorts that can be used for forecasting. Develop data pipeline for application integration with downstream systems. 
In this role, you will also recruit, mentor and guide junior team members and consultants to deliver reusable components and solutions. 

 ESSENTIAL REQUIREMENTS 

 
 MS in Computer Science or a related subject area with at least 5 years of server-side programming 
 At least 2 years of experience in AWS technologies 
 The documented ability of delivering innovative solutions in an applied environment related to at least one of the following areas: ETL, Data pipeline, Workflow. 
 Strong knowledge of programming in Python, Java, or Scala. 
 High level of competence in global and cross-skilled collaborative working. 
 Cloud Architecture: 1 year (Preferred) 
 Working experience in one or more of the AWS technologies 
 Amazon Glue, Sage Maker, Data pipeline, Kinesis, EMR (Hive, Presto, Spark) , Step Functions, Athena, Comprehend, Medical Comprehend 

 
 Familiarity with Container-based architecture 
 Microservice deployment using EKS or ECS 
 Familiarity with any Elastic search (or any other cloud-based search engine) 
 Experience in Database technologies like Amazon Aurora, Postgres 
 Well versed with SQL 
 DESIRABLE REQUIREMENTS 

 
 Knowledge/working experience claims, EMR, and lab data 
 Experience linking datasets 
 Experience with Auto ML in developing models based on AWS/Google Cloud Auto ML services 
 WHY JOIN US ? 
A place to do important work. We connect across the whole business to power each function to better influence patient outcomes and improve their lives. Impactful and valuable, this is where you come to raise your profile and do good for others. Rise to the challenge of shaping the future of an evolving business in the technology space. 

 SO, WHAT’S NEXT? 
Are you already envisioning yourself joining our team? Good, because we’d love to hear from you! Click the link to apply and we’ll be in touch as soon as we can. 

 WHERE CAN I FIND OUT MORE? 
Our Social Media, Follow AstraZeneca on LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/company/1603/ 
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

One in two people experience debilitating back, neck, shoulder, or joint pain — but traditional treatments have failed to meet their needs. Physical therapy can be expensive and hard to access; appointments often involve long commutes and missed work. Making matters worse, unresolved pain can trigger the overuse of opioids and surgeries.
  
  
  
    Join us in reimagining healthcare from the ground up. We’re making high-quality care accessible by pairing wearable sensors and computer vision with a world-class clinical team. Hinge Health puts a digital clinic in every member's pocket. Now millions of people can access personalized digital care from a physical therapist, guidance on behavior change from a health coach, and expert consultations with an orthopedic surgeon. With a single app and wearable technology like our Enso device, we’re helping to reduce pain, surgeries, and opioid use.
  
  
  
    About the Role
  
  
    As a Sr.Engineering Manager you'll manage a team of 10+ engineers to build, maintain and support a full stack system. Your team(s) will be tasked to solve several platform enablement/enhancement themed problems which will both directly and indirectly enable our core product engineering teams to deliver value faster to our users.
  
  
  
    As a leader of your team(s) you will be responsible for being a steward of operational excellence and engineering rigor. Fostering a culture of extreme ownership and high quality engineering is key. You will have the opportunity to delve into the code, but your priorities will be to your reports and to the engineering organization.
  
  
  
    Our Tech Stack
  
  
    Nodejs, TypeScript, Nestjs, GraphQL, Docker, React, React Native, Rails, Aptible, AWS, Postgres, Redis, Apollo, and Redux. Our workflow is trunk-based CI/CD.
  
 
  
  
 
  
    WHAT YOU’LL ACCOMPLISH
   
    
      Coach and mentor engineers through day-to-day challenges and guide them towards long term professional and technical growth
      Lead your team in consistently delivering on a roadmap they collaboratively define
      Motivate engineers and ensure high performance through constant feedback and identifying areas of improvementDevelop robust, effective plans addressing various technical and resource challenges within the organization
      Lead organizational initiatives on improving workflow processes and resolving them with practical, lightweight, measurable process
      Scale the team with a strong focus on experience, technical proficiency, and diversity
      Bring in automation focus from the start so that reliability is baked into the system
    
   
  
  
 
  
   WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR
   
    
      5+ years of Engineering Management experience in leading at least 8 plus engineers.
      Leadership: Track record of ownership for team-scale execution and technical excellence. Experience managing 5+ direct reports at a given time.
      Delivery: Strong project management skills to ensure the whole team is on track throughout the sprint and can sustainably deliver high quality work.
      Domain Expertise: In depth experience building software applications and the ability to propose several routes to accomplish business goals. Experience in handling SaaS environments.
      Problem Solving: Ability to resolve interpersonal conflicts, and find creative resourcing solutions where others would see zero-sum tradeoffs
      Communication: Clear, inclusive communication with both teammates and non-technical partners
      BS degree in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant field
    
   
  
  
 
  
   BONUS POINT
   
    
      Experience with Rails.
      Experience with AWS.
      Experience with Docker/Kubernetes
      Experience with Healthcare domain
    
   
  
  
 
  
   About Hinge Health:
  
  
    LinkedIn recently named Hinge Health one of the Top 50 Startups. Forbes, Fast Company, and Inc. have also recognized our technology, innovation, and culture.
  
  
  
    Since our founding in 2014, we've raised more than $800 million from leading investors, including Coatue and Tiger Global. We work with 1000 customers across every industry and the public sector — including Salesforce, Verizon, and the State of New Jersey — to give more than 23 million people access to the care they need. We’re positioned to continue leading the market with unmatched investments in clinical research, care innovation, machine learning, AI, and computer vision.
  
  
  
    Diversity and inclusion:
  
  
    We’re committed to building diverse teams that reflect the communities we serve. Visit hingehealth.com/diversity-equity-and-inclusion to learn more about what moves us.
  
  
  
    Hinge Health is an equal opportunity employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. We make employment decisions without regards to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, veteran status, disability status, pregnancy, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.
  
  
  
    We provide reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities. If you feel you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, let us know by reaching out to your recruiter.
  
  
  
    Disclaimer:
  
  
    There continues to be a significant increase in phishing attempts across all industries where fraudsters are impersonating real employees and sending fictitious job offers to applicants in a scheme to obtain sensitive information. Please note that we will never ask for your financial information at any part of the interview process including the post-offer stage, and will only correspond through @hingehealth.com domain email addresses.
  
  
  
    If you encounter any suspicious activity, we recommend you cease all communication with the individual and consider reporting them to the US FBI Internet Crime Complaint Center. If you would like to verify the legitimacy of an email you received from our recruiting team, please forward it to security@hingehealth.com.
    
  
  
   
  
   *Please do not send resumes via email*
  
  
  
    If you're interested - we'd love to hear from you.

Experienced data analyst position that uses technical skills to analyze data in response to new business requests and identify and resolve data discrepancies across multiple data sources and/or applications. Responsible for providing direction to other offshore resources to ensure a balance of workload. Works directly with the client user community and business analysts to define and document data requirements for data integration and business intelligence solution. Determines and documents data mapping rules for the movement of medium to high-complexity data between applications. Provides recommendations to Practitioners and clients as a result of the analysis. Active collaboration with Practitioners and clients on scope and delivery plan for requests and projects. Adheres to and promotes the use of data administration standards. and analyzes data from specific applications, systems, and/or databases to create reports and provide recommendations based on the analysis of the data. Investigates and resolve data issues across platforms and applications, including discrepancies in definition, format, and function. Creates and populates meta-data into repositories. May also create data flow diagrams and process models and integrates models across functional areas and platforms. May be responsible for employing data analysis skills to achieve data synchronization, redundancy elimination, source identification, data reconciliation, and problem root cause analysis.
   
   Key Roles and Responsibilities
   
  
   Primary role: Power BI Visualization (front-end) specialist driving data modeling and pipelining for Incident, Outage and Change management data of the Consumer ecosystem (over 400 applications and 40 AVP teams spanning across executive leadership organizations).
   Interpretation of business requirements/needs to drive queries and analysis of data from specific applications, systems, and/or databases (ex: Teradata, Vertica, Hadoop, Palantir) Consult with cross-functional teams on matters relating to statistics, knowledge discovery, data modeling, and analytics.
   Provide recommendations and perform techniques/approaches for root cause analysis for data discrepancies and quality issues based on inquiries from clients and the data platform team.
   Performs data selection, extraction, and quality checks for ad-hoc analysis and data files for client inquiries and broader team efforts.
   Provide support for other resources and maintain the balance of work and priorities to ensure delivery to meet commitments.
   Active collaboration with Practitioner and client teams around scope, analysis, and delivery plans.
   Create and present data analysis summaries that draw inferences, identify insights, and outline recommendations.
   Defines and documents business and technical metadata and data lineage.
   Create self-service reporting and analytics in various BI and visualization tools (ex: PowerBI/ Tableau / MicroStrategy).
   Determines and defines data flows and process flows supporting client needs.
  
 
 
 
   Experience: Typically requires overall 5 + years’ experience With a minimum of 2 -4 years of relevant experience. Data Analytical /Science / Machine Learning certification(s) preferred
   Specific Skill Set requires:
   
  
   5+ years experience in data analytics, data warehousing, root cause analytics, and requirements documentation.
   4+ Experience in Power BI, Power Automate, and Visualization tools
   4+ Experience in various complex dashboard development and visualization technics
   4+ years’ experience with Snowflake,Hadoop and data analysis techniques.
   3+ years’ Experience in Azure with cloud tools, Services, and Deep Data platform
   3+ years of experience in analyzing various data types and formats
   Expertise in SQL, well-versed with database connection and data retrieval process
   Expertise in Python and well-versed in Data analytical frameworks
   Experience delegating and managing work across delivery teams to meet priorities.
   Experience in client engagements, interpreting client’s business needs, and providing recommendations for data solutions
   Strong financial acumen and analysis experience to determine business impacts for the application of the statistical solution
   Experience in presentation design, development, delivery, and communication skills to present analytical results and recommendations for action-oriented data-driven decisions and associated operational and financial impacts.
   
   Flexible to work from 2:00 PM to 11:00 PM IST work timings
   
   Qualifications
   
   Education: Preferred Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, Statistics, Math, or Scientific Computing; Data Science or Machine Learning nano degree; or equivalent experience value add.
positionName: Sr Data Engineer (Front End All Data, PBI Dashboarding Visualization)

description:
About Us: 
 
 
  
 
  Eightfold was founded with a vision to solve for employment in our society. For decades, the connection between individuals and opportunities has been based on who the individuals are and the strength of their network, vs. their potential. Eightfold leverages artificial intelligence to transform how to think about skills and capabilities for individuals as well as how jobs and career decisions are made. Eightfold offers the industry’s first AI-powered Talent Intelligence Platform to transform how organizations plan, hire, develop and retain a diverse workforce, enabling individuals to transform their career.

If you are passionate about solving one of the most fundamental challenges of our society - employment, working on hard business problems and being part of an amazing growth story - Eightfold is the place to be! 
 
 
 
  You may want to refer to the media coverage on TechCrunch and Reuters. 
  Eightfold.ai is led by 
  Ashutosh Garg, a PhD in Machine Learning/IIT Delhi alumni who managed Search and Personalization at Google, and 
  Varun Kacholia- IIT Bombay alumni, who led the News Feed Ranking team at Facebook and developed YouTube Search at Google. 
 
 
 
  Our customers 
 
 
  Press ﻿ 
 
 
 
  About the Team: 
 
 
  Eightfold's product helps Enterprises worldwide to engage and retain employees by delivering personalized development paths for employees, managers & senior Leaders and HR personnel.
   
 
 
  
 
  An AI Software Development and Quality Engineer are responsible for ensuring the quality and reliability of AI systems and applications. This individual will play a critical role in ensuring that AI products meet customer requirements and industry standards, and are built to the highest level of data quality.
   
 
 
  
 
  Responsibilities: 
 
 
  
 
  Develop test plans and test cases: Develop and execute comprehensive test plans and test cases to validate AI systems and applications, and verify that they meet customer requirements. 
  Automated testing: Design and implement automated testing systems and frameworks to validate AI applications and systems at scale. 
  Collaborate with cross-functional teams: Collaborate with software developers, data scientists, and product managers to identify potential quality issues, and ensure they are addressed in a timely manner. 
  Analyze and report on performance: Analyze AI system performance, including accuracy, reliability, and scalability, and report findings to key stakeholders. 
  Identify and resolve issues: Identify and resolve problems with AI systems, including debugging and root cause analysis, and ensure that solutions are implemented to prevent similar issues from occurring. 
 
 
  
 
  Skills Required : 
 
 
  
 
  Strong technical background in AI and machine learning systems: The ideal candidate should have a deep understanding of AI and machine learning systems, including algorithms, models, and tools. 
  Experience with software testing and quality assurance methodologies: The candidate should have a strong understanding of software testing and quality assurance methodologies, including testing frameworks, tools, and best practices.

  Strong communication and collaboration abilities: The candidate should have excellent communication and collaboration abilities and work effectively with cross-functional teams. 
  Experience with automated testing tools and frameworks: The candidate should have experience with automated testing tools and frameworks, such as Selenium, TestNG, or JUnit. 
  Ability to work independently and effectively in a fast-paced environment: The candidate should be able to work independently and effectively in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment. 
  Knowledge of programming languages such as Python, Java, or C++: The candidate should have a strong understanding of at least one programming language, such as Python, Java, or C++. 
 
 
  
 
  Qualifications : 
 
 
  
 
  The ideal candidate should have a bachelor's degree in computer science, software engineering, or a related field, and several years of experience in AI quality assurance or a related role. 
  Strong technical background in AI and machine learning systems: 5+ years of experience in AI and machine learning systems, including hands-on experience testing AI Models and validating data quality. 
  Experience with software testing and quality assurance methodologies: 5+ years of experience in software testing and quality assurance, including experience with testing frameworks, tools, and best practices. 
  Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail: 5+ years of experience solving complex problems, including experience in debugging and root cause analysis. 
  Strong communication and collaboration abilities: 5+ years of experience collaborating with cross-functional teams, including experience working with software developers, data scientists, and product managers. 
  Experience with automated testing tools and frameworks: 3+ years of experience with automated testing tools and frameworks, such as Selenium, WebDriver, TestNG, or JUnit. 
  Experience in Python programming. 
  Ability to work independently and effectively in a fast-paced environment: 5+ years of experience working in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment. 
 
 
  
 
  We are a team of self-starters who excel in their fields. We believe in giving you responsibility, not a task. We want you to have ownership and pride in the work you are doing, and see the positive impact of your work on your colleagues, our customers, and the world. We believe in providing transparency and support, so you can do the best work of your career.

We are hiring a foundational engineering team in Bengaluru and looking for incredible engineers to build critical Moveworks projects. 
  As a member of the core infrastructure team, you will be responsible for architecting the next generation of the Moveworks AI infrastructure. As Moveworks grows fast, the infrastructure team is tasked with designing and operating reliable and resilient foundational services as well as frameworks that allow our product to scale seamlessly and our engineering teams to build customer facing features very rapidly. 
  We’re building a team that indexes on moving fast, solving challenging product/engineering problems and providing value to our customers. To be successful, you'll be partnering with machine learning, search, product, data, and full stack teams to identify, define and build elegant solutions. This is an opportunity to play an integral role at the fastest-growing AI startup in its space. 
  Who we are: 
  Moveworks is revolutionizing how companies support their employees — with the first AI platform that makes getting help at work effortless. Using advanced conversational AI built for the enterprise, Moveworks gives employees exactly what they need, from IT support to HR help to policy information. Our platform allows customers like DocuSign, Broadcom to move forward on what matters. 
  Founded in 2016, Moveworks has raised $315 million in funding, at a valuation of $2.1 billion. We’ve been named to the Forbes AI 50 list for three consecutive years, while earning recognition as the Best Chatbot Solution at the 2021 AI Breakthrough Awards. Above all, we’ve built an AI company that puts people first, which is why both Inc. and the San Francisco Business Times called Moveworks one of the Best Workplaces of 2021. 
  Come join one of the fastest-growing teams on the planet! 
  What you’ll do: 
 
  Closely work with machine learning, search, product, data, and frontend teams, understand their infrastructure needs, influence infrastructure roadmap, and lead as well as execute on various projects 
  Architect and build out the core infrastructure and foundational functionalities such as distributed key value store, schema-less data store, authentication and authorization, event streaming, distributed configuration management and hot reloading, rate limiting and circuit breaking, system for feature flags and A/B testing, traffic capture and replay, etc. 
  Improve observability and reliability of Moveworks systems by building and enhancing distributed logging, tracing, monitoring, and alerting infrastructure 
  Define methodologies and metrics to measure performance of microservices and product functionalities, identify and fix bottlenecks, as well as improve overall performance and scalability of Moveworks applications 
  Regularly deliver deadline sensitive work that is interdependent with other engineering teams 
 
 What you bring to the table: 
 
  5+ years of experience designing, building, shipping, and maintaining backend distributed systems 
  Familiarity with Python/Golang/Java/C++ 
  Experience with containers/Docker, and with cloud infrastructure like AWS/GCP/Azure 
  Desire to work at a startup pace in a small company with a high degree of ownership 
  Experience solving for performance, optimization, scalability, latency, and monitoring 
  Strong motivation, gumption, and an appetite for continuous, incremental changes and completing challenging projects fast 
  BS+ in computer science or a related field or equivalent relevant experience 
  High level of curiosity about engineering outside of your immediate discipline and an incessant desire to learn

About us
 
  At ExxonMobil, our vision is to lead in energy innovations that advance modern living and a net-zero future. As one of the world’s largest publicly traded energy and chemical companies, we are powered by a unique and diverse workforce fueled by the pride in what we do and what we stand for.
 
  The success of our Upstream, Product Solutions and Low Carbon Solutions businesses is the result of the talent, curiosity and drive of our people. They bring solutions every day to optimize our strategy in energy, chemicals, lubricants and lower-emissions technologies.
 
  We invite you to bring your ideas to ExxonMobil to help create sustainable solutions that improve quality of life and meet society’s evolving needs. Learn more about our What and our Why and how we can work together.
 
  
   
     What role you will play in our team
   
   
     We are looking to hire candidates to work on challenging engineering, geological and commercial problems that focus on exploration, development, production, marketing and transportation of hydrocarbons. A successful candidate would understand a problem in oil and gas space (both commercially/economically and technically), be able to formulate the problem in a solvable way, using application of engineering, numerical, data science and programming skills to tackle a range of problems in the oil and gas industry
   
  
  
   
     What you will do
   
   
    
      Work with computational scientists, data scientists, engineers, software developers, and geoscientists across the globe to develop, deliver and apply computational tools, models, or software to support our business
      Enhance proprietary computational models and tools to address evolving business needs
      Use machine learning, pattern recognition, deep learning, statistical analysis and data visualizations – along with domain knowledge and subject-specific models (Eg. physics-based) – to solve science, engineering, commercial problems and provide business insights
      Design, build, and execute studies using proprietary or commercial tools to provide insights including calibrating models to field data and providing field optimization recommendations 
    
   
  
  
   
     About You
   
   
     Skills and Qualifications
    
      Master's degree from a recognized university in one of the following disciplines: Chemical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or related disciplines with minimum GPA 7.0 (out of 10.0) and above
      Professional work experience in developing, applying, and analyzing physics-based models and/or data driven computational models and simulations.
      Minimum 3 years of applied computational work experience for candidates with a Master's degree.
      Ability to understand, enhance and apply computational models
      Familiarity with general numerical analysis and methods for solving differential equations
      Experience with developing, applying and validating physics-based or data-driven tools to model complex systems
      Familiarity with Statistical analysis, regression, classification
      Strong engineering fundamentals
      Ability to formulate complex problems in a solvable way
      Software Skills
      Competent to expert level programming experience
      Background in C/C++/Python or Matlab as well as Object oriented programming 
    
   
  
  
   
     Preferred Qualifications / Experience
   
   
    
      Prior knowledge of commercial software development and/or experience in commercial software teams
      Software testing and development practices (Agile)
      Experience with application of optimization tools in Matlab/Python for engineering problems
      Strong communication and interpersonal skills
      Familiarity with Oil and Gas Industry 
    
   
  
  
   
     Your benefits
   
   
     An ExxonMobil career is one designed to last. Our commitment to you runs deep our employees grow personally and professionally, with benefits built on our core categories of health, security, finance and life. We offer you:
    
    
      Competitive compensation
      Medical plans, maternity leave and benefits, life, accidental death and dismemberment benefits
      Retirement benefits
      Global networking & cross-functional opportunities
      Annual vacations & holidays
      Day care assistance program
      Training and development program
      Tuition assistance program
      Workplace flexibility policy
      Relocation program
      Transportation facility
    
    
     Please note benefits may change from time to time without notice, subject to applicable laws. The benefits programs are based on the Company’s eligibility guidelines.
   
  
  
   
     Stay connected with us
   
   
    
      Learn more about ExxonMobil in India, visit ExxonMobil India and Energy Factor India.
      Follow us on LinkedIn and ExxonMobil (@exxonmobil) • Instagram photos and videos 
     Like us on Facebook
      Subscribe our channel at YouTube

     ExxonMobil is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin or disability status.

Who We Are 
  
  Goldman Sachs ETF Accelerator is a new digital platform that enables our institutional clients to quickly and efficiently, launch, list, and manage their ETFs. This unique, “ETF infrastructure as a service” product is being built from the ground up , in an ambitious and dynamic environment. We are a global team of ETF specialists, software engineers, product managers and designers looking for passionate individuals who thrive on teams that rapidly ideate and iterate, to produce the best product for our clients. 
  Join us on our journey and influence the architecture and implementation we use to develop this innovative digital platform. 
  
  Goldman Sachs Engineering Culture 
  At Goldman Sachs, our Engineers don’t just make things – we make things possible. Change the world by connecting people and capital with ideas. Solve the most challenging and pressing engineering problems for our clients. Join our engineering teams that build massively scalable software and systems, architect low latency infrastructure solutions, proactively guard against cyber threats, and leverage machine learning alongside financial engineering to continuously turn data into action. Create new businesses, transform finance, and explore a world of opportunity at the speed of markets 
  Engineering is at the critical center of our business, and our dynamic environment requires innovative strategic thinking and immediate, real solutions. Want to push the limit of digital possibilities? Start here! 
  
  The Role 
  
   Develop APIs, workflows and libraries that handle our core functionality 
   Be involved in all phases of software development life cycle (SDLC) including effort estimation, the gathering of business requirements, the design, development, reviewing, building, testing, and deployment of commercial scale software changes 
   Make code quality decisions, and ship solutions to provide value to our business 
   Collaborate with product managers, designers, our business, and other engineers to define product vision and objectives 
   Work as part of a team to hit delivery milestones and navigate blocker issues 
   Apply agile methodologies in a sprint-based development team 
   Engage with support teams to troubleshoot and solve production issue faced by users 
   Analyze new tools and technologies from the Java community to proof of concept and come up with recommendations to integrate into our platform 
  
  
  Basic Qualifications 
  
   Bachelor’s degree or relevant work experience in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Electrical Engineering or related discipline 
   2 years of software development experience, or 1+ with an advanced degree 
   1+ years of Java experience 
   Experience with REST and/or GraphQL 
   Excellent object oriented or functional analysis and design skills 
   Strong knowledge of data structures, algorithms, and designing for performance 
   Effective written and verbal communication skills 
   Comfortable multi-tasking and working as part of a global team 
  
  
  Preferred Qualifications 
  
   Experience with AWS or similar Cloud platforms 
   Experience building scalable and distributed micro-services 
   Experience working with an event-based architecture e.g. Kafka 
   Experience with NoSQL databases e.g. MongoDB 
   Experience with Snowflake 
   Commercial awareness 
  
 
 
 
  ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS 
 
 
 
  At Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869, we are a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York, we maintain offices around the world. 
 
 
 
  We believe who you are makes you better at what you do. We're committed to fostering and advancing diversity and inclusion in our own workplace and beyond by ensuring every individual within our firm has a number of opportunities to grow professionally and personally, from our training and development opportunities and firmwide networks to benefits, wellness and personal finance offerings and mindfulness programs. Learn more about our culture, benefits, and people at GS.com/careers. 
 
 
 
  We’re committed to finding reasonable accommodations for candidates with special needs or disabilities during our recruiting process. Learn more: https://www.goldmansachs.com/careers/footer/disability-statement.html
   
 
 
 
  © The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2021. All rights reserved.

description:
At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible — and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way. When you join #TeamAmex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day. We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That’s why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.
  
  As part of our diverse tech team, you can architect, code and ship software that makes us an essential part of our customers’ digital lives. Here, you can work alongside talented engineers in an open, supportive, inclusive environment where your voice is valued, and you make your own decisions on what tech to use to solve challenging problems. Amex offers a range of opportunities to work with the latest technologies and encourages you to back the broader engineering community through open source. And because we understand the importance of keeping your skills fresh and relevant, we give you dedicated time to invest in your professional development. Find your place in technology on #TeamAmex. How will you make an impact in this role? You Lead the Way. Got Your Back.  From building next-generation apps and microservices in Kotlin to using AI to help protect our customers from fraud, you could be doing transformational work that brings our iconic, global brand into the future. As a part of our tech team, we could work together to bring ground-breaking and diverse ideas to life that power the digital systems, services, products and platforms that millions of customers around the world depend on. If you love to work with APIs, contribute to open source, or use the latest technologies, support you with an open environment and learning culture to grow your career.  Focus: Designs, develops, solves problems, debugs, evaluates, modifies, deploys, and documents software and systems that meet the needs of customer-facing applications, business applications, and/or internal end user applications. Organizational Context: Member of a product engineering or delivery and integration team reporting to a Senior Engineer Manager or Engineering Director. The position of Engineer I EGRC Archer will be a part of a dynamic and growing team within the Global Risk & Compliance Technology organization at American Express. The successful candidate will participate as a member on an agile team by contributing to software builds through consistent development practices (tools, common components, and documentation). The scrum team is responsible for designing scalable and optimal solutions across the Compliance, Risk, and Audit domains with hands on configuring in RSA Archer software as well as cutting edge technology to offer the best solution to support the business needs. This colleague will have the ability to Influence team members with creative changes and improvements by challenging status quo and demonstrating risk taking, providing RSA Archer experience, leveraging Business and Technical knowledge and helping to develop and implement business partner strategies on time and within budget. How will you make an impact in this role? Software Development 
 
  Beginner level ability in software development, such coding assignments 
  Function as member of an agile team by contributing to software builds through consistent development practices (tools, common components, and documentation) 
  Participate in code reviews and automated testing 
  Debug basic software components and identify code defects for remediation 
  Enable the deployment, support, and monitoring of software across test, integration, and production environments 
  Automate deployments in test or production environments 
  Automatically scale applications based on demand projections 
  
 #CD# Leadership 
 
  Demonstrate increased self-reliance to achieve team goals 
  Influence team members with creative changes and improvements by challenging status quo and demonstrating risk taking
 
  
  Range of Impact/Influence: 
 
  Accountable for team completing work you&rsquo#CD#re leading and work you are doing as agreed upon 
  Accountable to team for delivery of quality work 
  
 
  You just shape the world of software. You'll shape the world of life, work and play. Â Our Software Engineers not only understand how technology works, but how that technology intersects with the people who count on it every day. Today, innovative ideas, insight and new perspectives are at the core of how we create a more powerful, personal and fulfilling experience for all our customers. So if you are interested in a career creating breakthrough software and making an impact on an audience of millions, look no further. Â You wont just keep up, you' ll break new ground There are hundreds of opportunities to make your mark on technology and life at American Express. Here just some of what will be doing: Â - Taking your place as a core member of an agile team driving the latest development practices - Writing code and unit tests, working with API specs and automation - Identifying opportunities for adopting new technologies.
   
  Minimum Qualifications
   
  
   5+ years of software development experience in a professional environment and/or comparable experience
   2+ years configuring in RSA Archer Software including experience with 6.x series as an Archer Administrator
   Holds RSA administration certification
   Experience using applicable programming methodologies: JavaScript, API (Restful), XML, .net.
   Hands-on expertise with application design, software development, and automated testing
   Experience with distributed (multi-tiered) systems, algorithms, and relational databases
   Bachelor’s Degree in computer science, computer science engineering, or related experience required; advanced degree preferred
   Proven experience with application solutions to develop documentation, adhere to standards, and follow SDLC methodology
   
  Preferred Qualifications
  
 
  Machine Learning knowledge is a plus, not mandatory 
  Excellent verbal and written communication skills demonstrated by the ability to present complicated Technical solutions to Senior leaders 
  
 American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.
  Offer of employment with American Express is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background verification check, subject to applicable laws and regulations.

WHAT YOU'LL DO
  Join a team of data engineers and architects who are at the forefront of transforming the BCG’sdata landscape. We are currently building a centralized Data Lake that will simplify and automate data delivery, providing advanced insights and analytics to support decision-making across the organization. Our goal is to empower business leaders with the information they need to make informed decisions and drive business growth.
  
  The Data Engineer role is a vital member of an Agile team with a focus on delivering advanced business intelligence through data. The role is responsible for designing, building, and maintaining data infrastructure to support data-driven decision-making across the enterprise.
  
  Responsibilities would include:
 
   Designing and implementing data pipelines, data warehousing, and data governance solutions
   Collaborating with data analysts and other stakeholders to understand and support the analytical needs of the business
   Building scalable, high-performance data infrastructure to support analytical and machine learning workloads
   Ensuring data quality and integrity through proper data governance practices
   Participating in Agile development processes and collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver data-driven insights that support decision-making
 
  YOU'RE GOOD AT
  Data as a concept and DataEngineering
 
   Identifying and defining data engineering problems: Understand business objectives and identify areas where data engineering can help in enabling data for analytics.
   Proposing data engineering solutions with right tools/tech
   Developing and implementing data engineering pipelined:Use analytical insights to design and implement solutions that address data problems, using various coding and data engineering
   methods.
 
  Communication, interpersonal and teaming skills
 
   You work positively and collaboratively with others and within a team, and you build strong and lasting relationships
   You adapt your style to changing situations and audiences with tact, poise, and patience.
   You should be comfortable connecting & engaging with people across cultures, backgrounds and geographies within BCG
   You ask the right questions, share ideas within &across projects with an analytical mindset
 
  Work Management, organization, and planning
 
   Must be able to perform successfully in a fast-paced, intellectually intense, service-oriented environment
   You will be working in an Agile environment
   Strong Organizational skills
   Ability to prioritize efforts accordingly.
 
  YOU BRING (EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS)
  Strong understanding of end-to-end data, engineering tasks & responsibilities.
 
   Very good understanding of data as a concept & capabilities of data & analytics platform.
   Should have clear understanding of data warehousing, ETL and data pipeline concepts.
   SQL is heavily used across the team, so having solid understanding of it is crucial to success in this role.
   Good understanding & exposure to cloud platforms i.e., AWS.
   Snowflakeexperience is preferred as the MPP technology is widely used across the organization.
   As a college graduate, it is important to have a strong understanding of computer science fundamentals, data structure and algorithms.
   Strong programming skills in Python, PySpark or Scala.
   Understanding of data modelling and data governancebest practices.
   Ability to write new code i.e., well-documented and stored in a version control system (we use GitHub)
   Familiarity with JIRA & Confluence. Process management knowledge is a must.
   Good to have exposure to data-platform technologies such as DBT, Talend, FiveTran, Compose, Apache airflowand Snowflake.
   Strong attention to detail and ability to work with large datasets & complex systems.
   In this role, you’ll collaborate with analysts, senior engineers, product owners and other stakeholders to understand their data needs and implement solutions.
   As a data engineer in our agile organization, you will have the opportunity to work on a variety of projects, use advanced technologies and be a part of a team that values adaptability, flexibility, and continuous improvement.
   Strong communication skills. 
 
  
 YOU'LL WORK WITH
  As a member of the Data Tribe Team, you will interact extensively with a diverse range of stakeholders from across the business, both geographically and functionally. This includes, but is not limited to Local, Regional, Global teams. Being part of the Global Data Tribe team, coordinating and working with our other core product squads will play a large part in this role.

DataVisualizationEngineer
  Headquartered in Dublin, Ohio, Cardinal Health, Inc. (NYSE: CAH) is a global, integrated healthcare services and products company connecting patients, providers, payers, pharmacists and manufacturers for integrated care coordination and better patient management. Backed by nearly 100 years of experience, with more than 50,000 employees in nearly 60 countries, Cardinal Health ranks among the top 20 on the Fortune 500.
  Department Overview
  augmented Intelligence (augIntel) builds automation, analytics and artificial intelligence solutions that drive success for Cardinal Health by creating material savings, efficiencies and revenue growth opportunities. The team drives business innovation by leveraging emerging technologies and turning them into differentiating business capabilities.
  Job Overview
  Designing, building and operationalizing visualization and user interface (UI) solutions (department, business unit, and enterprise level) leveraging data sourced from Google Cloud Platform and AtScale. Expect high proficiency in visualization (i.e. Tableau, Looker, Excel) and user interface concepts and design leveraging best in class tools to represent and provide access to insights in data repositories, machine learning models, and artificial intelligence applications.
  Responsibilities
 
   Designing and implementing data visualization and user interfaces leveraging tools that connect to GCP cloud tools and services as well as AtScale
   Designing and building visualizations in conjunction with machine learning algorithms (process and outputs) and providing visibility to next best actions to take
   Working with both business users and developers, draft visualization requirements and provide innovative ideas that are well beyond reporting “what happened?”
   Analyzing, re-architecting and re-platforming existing visualization that may point to local data sources or databases and recreating in GCP
   Re-engineering business logic imbedded in existing visualizations that need to be integrated into GCP data stores to enable sharing across other business functions
   Designing and implementing data pipelines, ingestion and curation functions on GCP cloud using GCP native or custom programming.

   Experience architecting and implementing data visualizations that visually present complex data and/or metric relationships to users for exploration, analysis and action

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, pregnancy, veteran status, marital status, creed, status with regard to public assistance, genetic status or any other status protected by federal, state or local law.

HP’s Digital Mission 
 HP’s ambition is to utilize the power of data and AI, the possibilities of automation and robotics, to digitally transform ourselves to improve the customer, partner, and employee experience to deliver a competitive advantage, reduce cost and complexity, and to fuel new disruptive business models that both advance and disrupt.
 
  Position Overview 
 In support of HP’s mission to drive a more digitally enabled workplace, we are seeking an individual for the role of “Automation Coach and al Solution Architect” to be part of our Digital Solutions team with in Finance. With the objective of accelerating HP’s journey with cognitive automation at scale and citizen-led automation, this role will be responsible for creating solutions by leveraging RPA and adjacent technologies such as NLP, OCR, Chatbots etc. to drive business process automation.
 
  Scope & Impact:
 
   Works with product managers to understand the business problem.
   Works with software engineers to understand systems, where model will be dropped into.
   Simplify and build Automation solutions and architecture using Robotics Process Automation and other automation & machine learning skills.
   Collaborates with peers, engineers, SMEs and external and internal research and product development partners.
   Typically interacts with high-level Individual Contributors, Managers and Program Core Teams.
   Participates in projects requiring Robotics Process Automation and associated technologies
 
 
  What you would be doing:
 
   The RPA Solution Architect builds design, oversee development, testing the automation solution & workflows and supporting the implementation of the RPA solution. Works closely with the business in documenting / recording process details and with the engagement team in implementing/testing the solution (manage exceptions) as well as maintenance/change control of existing artifacts.
   Coordinate with process owners and business to understand the as-is process to design the automation solution and documentation of the design. Responsible for creating the process documentation (PDD/SDD etc).
   Provides guidance and help with process design from automation perspective with a strong end to end process mindset and challenges the status quo with growth mindset, championing simplified process and solutions
   Provide consulting in maintaining all Robots including their monitoring and stability. Provide on-going operational support including upgrades, defect fixes and any process change activities
   Design, develop, and test solutions to automate processes, activities, and tasks using RPA tools/ technologies, following agile principles
   Contribute to re-usability by developing objects and common libraries, ensuring they are easily maintainable, easy to understand, and reusable
   Build solution with awareness of the financial architecture, adhere to controls and compliance requirements applicable to the business requirement
   Deliver automation solutions/PoC’s by developing system requirements, designing, prototyping, and testing custom technology solutions, and supporting system implementation
   Independently Deliver technical training, demos, blueprints and provide necessary consulting & support to business users/stakeholders
   Create and document test procedures and scenarios prior to launching User Acceptance Testing (UAT). Create and document architecture standards and framework for onboarding new technologies and platforms. Support business teams in testing activities, including end-to-end (business process) testing and UAT
   Coordinate work effort in partnership with a team of local or remote SMEs (functional / operations) to support the delivery of projects. Play the role of a change agent and constantly seeking, sharing & implementing best practices
   Learn and utilize new exciting technologies like OCR, NLP, Chatbots, AI/ML etc. and how they integrate with UiPath
 
 
  What you will bring:
  Education and Experience:
 
   Degrees in Computer Science, Statistics, and/or Finance are preferred
   15+ years of work experience in software development and RPA technologies (UiPath Developer Certification is a must)
   Be intimately familiar with technologies such as Microsoft Power Automate, UiPath, CyberArk, AWS, Expertise on SQL & ASP.Net and VMware.
   Expert understanding of RPA Deployment Methodology and opportunity identification / process optimization is required. Experience with process re-engineering, automation across various process domains
   Excellent, proactive problem solver, strong analytical skills with the ability to analyze complex requirements and define technical/functional advanced solutions
   Able to work independently, choose the model, tune model and provide larger business solutions
   Excellent communication skills in both written & verbal English (and have worked in global/multicultural environment)
 
 
  Complexity:
 
   Work independently, lead teams, analyze and use advanced multiple models.
   Masters are able to work on multiple projects and use different approaches.
   High
 
 
  Education and Experience:
 
   Degrees in Computer Science, Statistics, and/or Math are preferred.
   Masters degree preferred. Bachelors minimum. Needs to demonstrate knowledge and skills through projects and/or academic publications.
   10+ years of work experience in related field.
 
 
   About HP
 
  
  
  
 
  You’re out to reimagine and reinvent what’s possible—in your career as well as the world around you.
  
 
   So are we. We love taking on tough challenges, disrupting the status quo, and creating what’s next. We’re in search of talented people who are inspired by big challenges, driven to learn and grow, and dedicated to making a meaningful difference.
 
  
  
 
   HP is a technology company that operates in more than 170 countries around the world united in creating technology that makes life better for everyone, everywhere.
 
  
  
 
   Our history: HP’s commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion – it's just who we are.
  
 
   From the boardroom to factory floor, we create a culture where everyone is respected and where people can be themselves, while being a part of something bigger than themselves. We celebrate the notion that you can belong at HP and bring your authentic self to work each and every day. When you do that, you’re more innovative and that helps grow our bottom line. Come to HP and thrive!
